definitions: hard outer layer of cereal grains removed during milling
examples: Add wheat bran to your morning cereal for extra fiber
The bakery uses rice bran in their healthy bread recipes

definitions: process or pattern of dividing into smaller parts from a main structure
examples: The river's branching creates a vast delta system downstream
Scientists studied the branching patterns in coral reef formations

definitions: process of creating distinctive identity and image for products or companies
act of burning marks onto surfaces for identification purposes
examples: The company invested heavily in branding to attract younger customers
Their branding strategy included a new logo and marketing campaign
Cattle branding helps ranchers identify their livestock on open ranges
The ancient practice of branding dates back thousands of years

definitions: alcoholic drink made by distilling wine or fermented fruit juice
examples: He poured himself a glass of French brandy after dinner
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of cherry brandy

definitions: informal restaurant serving traditional French food in relaxed atmosphere
examples: The new brasserie downtown serves excellent steak frites daily
We met for lunch at a charming brasserie near the museum

definitions: child who behaves badly and annoys other people frequently
examples: The spoiled brat threw a tantrum in the grocery store
Don't be such a brat about sharing your toys

definitions: confident or brave behavior intended to impress others but often hiding fear
examples: His bravado couldn't hide his nervousness before the big presentation
The teenager's bravado disappeared when confronted by the principal

definitions: quality of being ready to face danger or pain without showing fear
examples: The firefighter's bravery saved three children from the burning building
It takes real bravery to stand up for your beliefs

definitions: shouted expression of approval or praise for a performance
examples: The audience shouted bravo after the soprano's stunning aria performance
Bravo to the chef for this incredible five-course meal

definitions: great technical skill and confidence shown in artistic performance or activity
examples: The pianist's bravura performance earned a standing ovation from everyone
Her bravura display of cooking skills impressed the television judges

definitions: noisy fight involving several people in a public place
examples: A brawl broke out between rival fans after the soccer match
The bar brawl resulted in several arrests last night

definitions: person who frequently gets into rough physical fights with others
examples: The notorious brawler was banned from every pub in town
He had a reputation as a brawler during his younger days

definitions: physical strength and well-developed muscles rather than intelligence
examples: The job requires more brawn than brains to move heavy equipment
His impressive brawn made him perfect for construction work

definitions: loud harsh cry made by a donkey or similar sound
examples: The donkey's bray echoed across the quiet farmyard at dawn
His laugh sounded like the bray of a mule

definitions: metal container for holding burning coals or wood for warmth
examples: Street vendors warmed their hands over a glowing brazier in winter
The blacksmith kept coals hot in an iron brazier

definitions: gap or hole made by breaking through a wall or defense
act of breaking a law, agreement, or code of conduct
examples: Water poured through the breach in the dam wall dangerously
Enemy forces exploited a breach in the castle's defenses
The company faced lawsuits for breach of contract with suppliers
His actions constituted a serious breach of professional ethics

definitions: large round starchy fruit from tropical trees used as food
examples: Breadfruit is a staple food in many Pacific island nations
The roasted breadfruit tasted similar to freshly baked bread

definitions: distance from one side of something to the other side
wide range or extent of knowledge, interests, or activities
examples: The breadth of the river made it difficult to swim across
Measure the breadth of the fabric before cutting the pattern
Her breadth of knowledge impressed everyone at the conference presentation
The museum's breadth of collections spans five thousand years

definitions: person who earns money to support their family's living expenses
examples: As the sole breadwinner, she worked two jobs to support her family
Both parents are breadwinners in most modern households today

definitions: damage caused when things are broken or the broken items themselves
examples: The moving company will compensate for any breakage during transport
There was minimal breakage despite the earthquake's strong tremors

definitions: group that separates from larger organization or sudden escape from others
examples: The breakaway faction formed their own political party last year
The cyclist made a breakaway from the main pack

definitions: failure of a system, relationship, or person's mental health
detailed examination of information divided into categories or parts
examples: The car breakdown left them stranded on the highway for hours
She suffered a nervous breakdown from excessive work stress
Here's a breakdown of expenses for the quarterly budget report
The breakdown shows that marketing costs increased by twenty percent

definitions: large wave that breaks into foam when reaching the shore
automatic switch that stops electrical current flow when overloaded
examples: Surfers waited patiently for the perfect breaker to ride
The breakers crashed against the rocky coastline with tremendous force
The circuit breaker tripped when too many appliances were running
Check the breaker box if you lose power suddenly

definitions: process or action of causing something to separate into pieces
examples: The breaking of dawn brought hope to the weary travelers
We heard the breaking of glass from the kitchen accident

definitions: escape from prison or similar place of confinement
sudden appearance or development of something, especially success
examples: The prison breakout involved three inmates and careful planning
Police searched for participants in yesterday's jail breakout
Her breakout performance in the film launched her acting career
The company had a breakout year with record profits

definitions: important discovery or development that helps solve a problem
examples: Scientists announced a major breakthrough in cancer treatment research today
The breakthrough in negotiations ended the month-long labor strike

definitions: end of a romantic relationship between two people
separation of something into smaller parts or groups
examples: Their breakup was difficult but necessary for both of them
She needed time to heal after the painful breakup
The breakup of the company into smaller divisions improved efficiency
Spring brings the breakup of ice on northern rivers

definitions: wall built out into the sea to protect a harbor from waves
examples: The stone breakwater protects the marina from violent storm waves
Fishermen often cast their lines from the old breakwater

definitions: type of deep-bodied freshwater fish found in rivers and lakes
examples: The angler caught several bream using simple worm bait yesterday
Bream are popular fish for recreational fishing in lakes

definitions: piece of armor covering the chest worn by soldiers in battle
examples: The knight's steel breastplate deflected the enemy's sword strike effectively
Medieval breastplates were often decorated with family crests

definitions: swimming stroke performed face down with arms and legs moving symmetrically
examples: She won the gold medal in the 200-meter breaststroke competition
Breaststroke is often the first stroke taught to beginners

definitions: short pause or break taken to rest and recover strength
examples: Let's take a quick breather before climbing the next hill
The workers took a breather after moving heavy furniture

definitions: back part of a gun barrel where bullets are loaded
position where baby's bottom comes first during birth
examples: The soldier carefully loaded ammunition into the rifle's breech mechanism
Old cannons were loaded through the breech for safety
The doctor identified a breech presentation during the ultrasound examination
Breech births often require special medical attention and care

definitions: trousers that end just below the knee, worn especially for riding
examples: The equestrian wore leather breeches for the jumping competition today
Colonial gentlemen typically wore silk breeches to formal occasions

definitions: particular variety of animal developed by selective mating
type or kind of person or thing with specific characteristics
examples: The farm specializes in raising a rare breed of sheep
This breed of dog requires daily exercise and grooming
Success attracts a certain breed of ambitious people to Silicon Valley
She represents a new breed of environmentally conscious entrepreneurs

definitions: person who raises animals or plants to produce offspring with desired traits
examples: The dog breeder specialized in championship bloodlines for show competitions
Local breeders gathered to discuss improving livestock quality standards

definitions: process of animals producing offspring or raising them
good manners and behavior showing proper social background
examples: Selective breeding has improved crop yields over many generations significantly
The breeding season for most birds begins in spring
Her excellent breeding was evident in her gracious manner
Good breeding shows in how one treats service staff

definitions: quality of expressing something in very few words without unnecessary detail
examples: The brevity of his speech surprised everyone expecting lengthy remarks
Brevity is essential when writing headlines for newspapers

definitions: drink made by steeping, boiling, or fermenting ingredients
situation or trouble that is slowly developing
examples: The morning brew of coffee filled the kitchen with aroma
This herbal brew helps soothe sore throats naturally
There's trouble brewing between the two rival gang leaders
A storm is brewing on the western horizon

definitions: person or company that makes beer professionally or as business
examples: The local brewer won awards for their craft beer varieties
Master brewers spend years perfecting their recipes and techniques

definitions: building or place where beer is made commercially in large quantities
examples: The old brewery was converted into trendy apartment lofts downtown
Tours of the brewery include tastings of their signature beers

definitions: process of making beer or other drinks by fermentation
slow development of something, especially trouble or storm
examples: The art of brewing requires patience and attention to detail
Home brewing has become a popular hobby among millennials
Dark clouds suggest a storm is brewing over the mountains
Tension has been brewing between departments for months now

definitions: prickly shrub or plant, especially wild rose with thorny stems
examples: She scratched her arms pushing through the thick briar patch
The rabbit disappeared into the protective briar thicket quickly

definitions: money or gift given to influence someone's actions or decisions illegally
examples: The official was arrested for accepting a bribe from contractors
They offered a bribe to skip the long waiting list

definitions: act of giving or receiving bribes to influence official actions illegally
examples: The senator was convicted of bribery and removed from office
Bribery undermines trust in government institutions and fair competition

definitions: skilled worker who builds walls and structures using bricks and mortar
examples: The experienced bricklayer completed the garden wall in two days
My grandfather worked as a bricklayer for forty years

definitions: walls or structures built from bricks arranged in patterns
examples: The decorative brickwork on the Victorian house was beautifully preserved
Repairing old brickwork requires matching the original mortar color
